column4: Well anyone knowledgeable know why Ubuntu 9.04 would install fine, but 9.10 wouldn't?
Everytime I downloaded a 9.10 image it had an error in one file. And would cut off mid-installation.
different kernels, probably a regression.   What hardware are you on, and what do you mean by "doesn't install" ?
it would simple say that an error occurred during installation (check harddrive, makesure CD fine, etc.)
you might want to try installing from a USB thumb drive instead of CD
i tried installing with wubi, used unetbootin to create a usb burn, downloaded direct from ubuntu.com and downloaded a torrent.
when you say "error in one file", were you getting an error message?
something isn't adding up.
the error in 1 file was when scanning the disc for errors
using the built in scan tool on the disc
which disk, the USB thumb drive?

i technically tried installing 5 times. two of them using a CD and both times i checked the CD it said it had a file with an error. and it was from two different download locations that had sums checked
sometimes the disk-check does mess up.   But lets ignore that for a second, what happened when you installed from USB thumb drive?
it wouldn't even read from the USB drive.
9.04 ran from same usb drive fine.
my guess is you're having more than one problem.
i would ignore the disk-check and proceed with install, if it gives you an error, work from there

probably. just happy 9.04 is installed. just wondering if any known issues with 9.10 and hardware exist. any significant ones. i did do a search and came across other people that did the disk check and came up with the same error in a single file that had the same problem, but no one game a response to their problem on the forums.
how about any issues with scsi drives and karmic?
yes someone earlier complained of issue installing with SCSI cdrom, and had to go to USB
well it's a scsi hd
could be a problem of course, it's a new kernel, there might be a regression
